Methods and tools Brief summary Activities-Based Costing Cost accounting system that accumulates cost-based data on activities (ABC) performed and then uses cost drivers to allocate these costs to products or other bases, such as customers, markets, projects. Activities-Based Management Management system that uses an accounting system as the managing factor (ABM) to allocate costs to products based on resources used to produce the product. Advanced Product Quality Method to develop a product quality plan that will support development of a Planning (APQP) product or service with the main objective of customer satisfaction.
